project.teaser: "Cancer is the second leading cause of death in Europe with an expected increase of about 25% by 2035. A wide and unacceptable variability in terms of access to research, innovation and quality care exists between and within countries. Possible solutions are an increase in...
project.objective: "Cancer is the second leading cause of death in Europe with an expected increase of about 25% by 2035. A wide and unacceptable variability in terms of access to research, innovation and quality care exists between and within countries. Possible solutions are an increase in knowledge by funding research, and a more equitable transfer of what we already know to everyone. Comprehensive Cancer Centers and Comprehensive Cancer Care Networks may be the core of CCIs that deliver quality care and provide resources to improve and integrate care, research and education. Data already available confirm that the level of ""CCI maturity"" in Member States is widely different, from some countries lacking CCIs completely. A European initiative, implemented in all Member States, based on a capacity building programme (CBP), will help reduce inequalities, in the context of other actions ongoing, such as CRANE, JANE and UNCAN. CBP is a complex intervention that requires multiple and integrated actions delivered to all the relevant stakeholders. CBP will be designed with an inclusive approach, tailored to the baseline status, capable of creating a change and improvement in research and care, with greater integration between them, supported by an education programme. It will operate at various levels: Individuals, Institutions and Systems. The CSA will implement the following steps: define CCI Maturity Model including quality indicators; profile the CCIs in each MS and a few ACs in terms of CCI presence and levels of maturity; design tailored CBP interventions, giving priority to MSs without any CCI; deliver online training courses open to teams in all MSs and ACs, implement targeted onsite interventions; scale up and sustain development; disseminate, exploit and report results. The CSA will maximize impact by bridging with the work of ongoing EU cancer research projects. National focal points will be key informants in making the links between the CSA, the EC and MSs."
project.title: COMPREHENSIVE CANCER INFRASTRUCTURES 4 EUROPE
project.keywords: Comprehensive Cancer Infrastructures, Comprehensive Cancer Centres, Capacity Building, Tailored interventions, Team training, Integrating research and care, Maturity Model Inequalities

article.title: Cancer programme to reduce disparities in research

programme.title: Strengthening research capacities of Comprehensive Cancer Infrastructures

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Maturity model and maturity web tool
result.description: The deliverable concludes and documents the development and implementation of the CCI MM, as well as the collection and assessment functionalities of the web tool. It will also describe the method, rationale of the build, and evaluation process that lies behind the CCI-Maturity Model.

result.title: Definition of criteria and QI for CCI
result.description: WP2 will develop features/criteria and quality indicators (QI) which will define the framework for the structures and processes that should be implemented in CCIs. The features/criteria and quality indicators will be used to ensure sufficient flexibility in assessing the various CCI structures and, at the same time, allow a measurable comparison of the CCIs. The detailed features including Quality Indicators will be defined and agreed upon with all members of WP2.

result.title: Project's website
result.description: This deliverable will include an overview of the project website and its technical features.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CCI4EU (COMPREHENSIVE CANCER INFRASTRUCTURES 4 EUROPE)
result.teaser: Cancer is the second leading cause of death in Europe, with cases expected to rise by 25% by 2035. Significant disparities in access to research, innovation, and quality care persist between and within countries. Solutions include increasing knowledge through research funding...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Use of the digital learning infrastructure
result.description: The digital learning platform and its integrated infrastructure will allow the delivery of online educational materials and learning depositories that will integrate the in-person training sessions. A dedicated section of the www.e-ESO.net website will be created.

result.title: Dissemination, Communication and Exploitation Plan
result.description: Strategic framework, stakeholders mapping and analysis, operational plan for communication and dissemination activities.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable include the procedures implemented by the project to share, use and reuse data.

result.title: CB Foundation programme designed
result.description: Following the spirit of continuous improvement, every MS will be offered a Foundation CB program, which will include trainings for researchers in particular subjects of the 7 central themes like: talent attraction, designing of early and academic clinical trials, optimization of relationships with patient advocates, gender question in research or successful practices of excellence. The Foundation CB programme deliverable will include the actual list of topics with their objectives and the suggested most appropriate approach to achieve these objectives ( webinars, checklists, etc) as well as the proposed expert profile to prepare the materials.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
